org.jooby

Interface Request

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Request.Forwarding

    public interface Request
    Give you access at the current HTTP request in order to read parameters, headers and body.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Request.Forwarding
      Forwarding request.
      static interface  Request.Module
      Jooby doesn't use a custom scope annotation for request scoped object.

    • Method Detail

      • path

        @Nonnull
default String path()
        Given: 
          http://domain.com/some/path.html  -> /some/path.html
  http://domain.com/a.html          -> /a.html
        Returns:
        The request URL pathname.

      • verb

        default Verb verb()
        Returns:
        Current request verb.

      • type

        @Nonnull
MediaType type()
        Returns:
        The value of the Content-Type header. Default is: /.

      • accept

        @Nonnull
List<MediaType> accept()
        Returns:
        The value of the Accept header. Default is: /.

      • accepts

        @Nonnull
default Optional<MediaType> accepts(@Nonnull
                                             String... types)
        Check if the given types are acceptable, returning the best match when true, or else Optional.empty. 
         // Accept: text/html
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"

 // Accept: text/*, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("application/json" "text/plain");
 //  => "application/json"
 req.accepts("application/json");
 //  => "application/json"

 // Accept: text/*, application/json
 req.accepts("image/png");
 //  => Optional.empty

 // Accept: text/*;q=.5, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html", "application/json");
 //  => "application/json"
        Parameters:
        types - Types to test.
        Returns:
        The best acceptable type.

      • accepts

        @Nonnull
default Optional<MediaType> accepts(@Nonnull
                                             MediaType... types)
        Check if the given types are acceptable, returning the best match when true, or else Optional.empty. 
         // Accept: text/html
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"

 // Accept: text/*, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("application/json" "text/plain");
 //  => "application/json"

 //  => "application/json"

 // Accept: text/*, application/json
 req.accepts("image/png");
 //  => Optional.empty

 // Accept: text/*;q=.5, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html", "application/json");
 //  => "application/json"
        Parameters:

      • accepts

        @Nonnull
Optional<MediaType> accepts(@Nonnull
                                     List<MediaType> types)

         // Accept: text/html
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"

 // Accept: text/*, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("text/html");
 //  => "text/html"
 req.accepts("application/json" "text/plain");
 //  => "application/json"
 req.accepts("application/json");
 //  => "application/json"

 req.accepts("image/png");
 //  => Optional.empty

 // Accept: text/*;q=.5, application/json
 req.accepts("text/html", "application/json");
 //  => "application/json"
        Parameters:
        types - Types to test for.
        Returns:
        The best acceptable type.

      • params

        @Nonnull
Map<String,Mutant> params()
                            throws Exception
        Get all the available parameter. A HTTP parameter can be provided in any of these forms:
        • Path parameter, like: /path/:name or /path/{name}
        • Query parameter, like: ?name=jooby
        • Body parameter when Content-Type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data
        Returns:
        All the parameters.
        Throws:
        Exception - On param retrieval failures.

      • param

        @Nonnull
Mutant param(@Nonnull
                      String name)
               throws Exception
        Get a HTTP request parameter under the given name. A HTTP parameter can be provided in any of these forms:
        • Path parameter, like: /path/:name or /path/{name}
        • Query parameter, like: ?name=jooby
        • Body parameter when Content-Type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data
        The order of precedence is: path, query and body. For example a pattern like: GET /path/:name for /path/jooby?name=rocks produces: 
          assertEquals("jooby", req.param(name).stringValue());

  assertEquals("jooby", req.param(name).toList(String.class).get(0));
  assertEquals("rocks", req.param(name).toList(String.class).get(1));
        Uploads can be retrieved too when Content-Type is multipart/form-data see Upload for more information.
        Parameters:
        name - A parameter's name.
        Returns:
        A HTTP request parameter.
        Throws:
        Exception - On param retrieval failures.

      • header

        @Nonnull
Mutant header(@Nonnull
                       String name)
        Get a HTTP header.
        Parameters:
        name - A header's name.
        Returns:
        A HTTP request header.

      • headers

        @Nonnull
Map<String,Mutant> headers()
        Returns:

      • cookie

        @Nonnull
Optional<Cookie> cookie(@Nonnull
                                 String name)
        Get a cookie with the given name (if present).
        Parameters:
        name - Cookie's name.
        Returns:
        A cookie or an empty optional.

      • cookies

        @Nonnull
List<Cookie> cookies()
        Returns:
        All the cookies.

      • body

        @Nonnull
default <T> T body(@Nonnull
                            Class<T> type)
                     throws Exception
        Convert the HTTP request body into the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Body type.
        Parameters:
        type - A body type.
        Returns:
        The HTTP body as an object.
        Throws:
        Exception - If body can't be converted or there is no HTTP body.

        Parameters:
        type - A body type.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • charset

        @Nonnull
Charset charset()
        The charset defined in the request body. If the request doesn't specify a character encoding, this method return the global charset: application.charset.
        Returns:
        A current charset.

      • locale

        @Nonnull
Locale locale()
        Get the content of the Accept-Language header. If the request doens't specify such header, this method return the global locale: application.lang.
        Returns:
        A locale.

      • length

        long length()
        Returns:
        The length, in bytes, of the request body and made available by the input stream, or -1 if the length is not known.

      • ip

        @Nonnull
String ip()
        Returns:
        The IP address of the client or last proxy that sent the request.

      • route

        @Nonnull
Route route()
        Returns:
        The currently matched Route.

      • hostname

        String hostname()
        The fully qualified name of the client or the last proxy that sent the request. If the engine cannot or chooses not to resolve the hostname (to improve performance), this method returns the dotted-string form of the IP address
        Returns:
        The fully qualified name of the client or the last proxy that sent the request.

      • session

        Session session()
        Returns:
        The current session associated with this request or if the request does not have a session, creates one.

      • ifSession

        Optional<Session> ifSession()
        Returns:
        The current session associated with this request if there is one.

      • xhr

        default boolean xhr()
        Returns:
        True if the X-Requested-With header is set to XMLHttpRequest.

      • protocol

        String protocol()
        Returns:
        The name and version of the protocol the request uses in the form protocol/majorVersion.minorVersion, for example, HTTP/1.1

      • secure

        boolean secure()
        Returns:
        True if this request was made using a secure channel, such as HTTPS.
